techmeme.title: A profile of Joseph Firmage, who founded USWeb, which went public with a $2.5B market cap in 1997, and is now being sued by "antigravity-machine" investors (Brent Crane/Bloomberg)
XOi, whose software lets field technicians get info about the machines they need to fix, raised $230M from KKR and buys its rival Specifx for an undisclosed sum (Ingrid Lunden/TechCrunch)
Interviews with nearly two dozen VR studios on shipping games on Quest, Meta's increased focus on Horizon Worlds, concerns over declining game sales, and more (Henry Stockdale/UploadVR)
China's "mini-drama" industry grew 35% YoY to ~$6.91B in 2024, surpassing the country's box office and forcing iQiyi and Tencent to embrace short-form dramas (Sohee Kim/Bloomberg)
AI researchers at Stanford and the University of Washington claim they trained an AI reasoning model, called s1, for under $50 in cloud compute credits (Maxwell Zeff/TechCrunch)
